page.title: 12Population
page.content: Waternish is a peninsula in North-West Skye. Its population is fairly scattered. It is very rural. Many of the inhabitants are in-comers to the area; having moved here from the north of England. There seems to be no apparent reason for this. Many local people have moved away in search of work. One reason people might have for moving here is that there is a healthy and peaceful environment. The pace of life is much slower. People might move away to be nearer shops or hospitals. Some move because they don't like living in isolated places. The community has a fair cross-section of ages. There are eighteen pupils of secondary school age; sixteen of primary age and twelve of pre-school age. The oldest person in the community is a lady of ninety-four years of age.
